Reviews.Title: “Worst I've Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice. The first room I was given was 115. It smelled terrible, the bed had a dirty bedspread and no pillow. There were no towels, no hangers, no phone and the floor was disgusting. I brought the receptionist to my room who apologized profusely, and I was moved to another room 328. It didn't smell as bad and had towels but was still awful. The floor and rug were so horrible I kept my shoes on to walk on it. The wind whistled eerily through the door all night. I couldn't bring myself to shower there. I've stayed at other Suburban Extended Stay hotels and the rooms were cheap and clean and for the most part in good repair. I think this hotel needs to be condemned, Based on other reviews it sounds like they might have some ok rooms but I would never recommend this hotel based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DavidMagyar
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a week for work training and wanted something close by and cheap with a kitchen. This was, had a little kitchen so it was great for what I needed. Gave me convenient place to stay for a low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: plano81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and got a great weekly rate. It had a full kitchen (fridge, microwave, stove) and free wireless. The bed was comfy and new. I don't understand what kind of room people want if you're only paying $30 something dollars a night? If you want a Hilton or Marriott type room, you have to pay $200 dollars a night! I paid around $200 something for the whole WEEK! Anyway, if you want something super affordable, safe, clean, etc...This is a great choice. If you want to pay $1200 a week but cuter, go someplace else. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place ever we were new to Dallas doing a job and had the worst experience of our lives. This hotel is infested with roaches, bed bugs and ants. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Alexagfdg
Reviews.Content: To be a CHOICE HOTEL this place is NASTY !!! Dirty Dirty Dirty!!! The reviews I have read are all true.Elevators are dirty and so are the hallways .Carpet looks old and dingy.Rooms are out dated .Hotel hallways smell musty and all around Filthy Place.DO NOT CHOOSE THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Worst Management Ever”
Reviews.Author: LmichelleV
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at an extended stay hotel for my out-of-state move to Dallas, during the time it took for them to get my new apartment ready. Of course, being an obsessive dog-mom to a sweet, spoiled pit mix girl, I had to not only find someplace that was dog friendly but also "breed friendly". I called Suburban Extended Stay and had a great customer service rep who booked my room and assured me the dog would be no problem. He even offered me a discount. I got to the place after a 2 day drive and it was just OK -- kind of what you would expect for an extended stay -- but after a few nights my thoughts on the place plummeted: - It smells like weed in the hallways nightly but no one from management says anything about it. There are beer cans everywhere. - That being said, the clientele is trash, which I'm sure factors into my bullets not only above but also below. - The men who stay here are widely blue-collar, which is completely fine, but for some reason they are creepy and will blatantly stare and say things to you with no regard (I was happy my pup is part pit, to say the least). Maybe because there are at least 10 "gentlemen's clubs" within a 1-block radius? - The management is horrendous. Some loud, horrible, low-rent woman who does not care about the customer at all. - It is, in fact, not dog friendly at all. The maintenance came in my room without warning while I was at work, and because the dog was barking in her crate the neighbors complained. And because the neighbors complained the manager (mentioned above, horrible) called and yelled at me, and then continued to complain to me every time she saw me in person. Not only is this horrible customer service, but complete BS in any given social setting, how dumb can you be?! I didn't think my sweet little girl was safe being in her crate by herself the rest of the time and had to pay for dog daycare. Absolutely unacceptable. - IT IS NOT SAFE. what people say about the doors always being open is true. And, as alluded to, it's on a horrible side of town. - IT IS NOT CLEAN. Enough said. - THE HOTEL IS NOT HONEST. I never got the discount I was promised. When checking out, the front desk worker played dumb even though I gave him my confirmation number and the name of the customer service rep who helped me. Ridiculous! - The washers and dryers eat your money then don't work. And the manager (like I've said, horrible) blames the company that owns them and takes no responsibility. - IT IS NOT NICE. Run away. Don't stay here. If you have a dog, might as well board them for the price of daycare and stay someplace where you're not scared of being robbed, mugged, raped or contracting a disease from the disgusting surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a person who values life you...”
Reviews.Author: dat935rat
Reviews.Content: If you are a person who values life you will pay a few extra dollars for a different hotel. Outside doors remain unlocked for anybody to walk in. First walked in to 2 homeless men in the lobby. 1st rooms tv didn't work, 2nd room key didn't work cuz it was a storage room... not a guest room, 3rd room was HOT and had no remote. I was not about to request yet another room. After going back twice I noticed a sign that read no refunds. Ha, I wonder why. The amenities are very worn, stains on sheets, bed has dip in center from being so old, fridge made loud sound do to fan, door had dents and appeared to have chain replaced from somebody kicking it in, the elevator looked like it had 2 bullet holes. Its next to what appears to be a bad bar if you know what I mean. I made the mistake of being stuck here, I travel all the time for work and in 3 years this is by far the worst I've ever seen. Make the smart choice and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in a lifetime!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kungfu78
Reviews.Content: This is a ghetto hotel. I have not had sleep since the AC was not cooling at all and it is MAY. I slept in 100 degrees room with the AC on the coolest temperature and it was still 100 degrees.. I cannot describe in any words but to say that anyone who reads my experience learns from it. They do not even have a phone in the hotel room. They are saving money on providing accommodations for their customers. They do even have a remote for the TV. Can you believe how these guys treat their customers? READ THIS AND NEVER COME HERE AFTER YOU READ MY MESSAGE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Are you seeking a horrendous place to stay and bad customer service? You've found it!”
Reviews.Author: OUlover
Reviews.Content: I want to start out by saying that when it comes to hotels that I am very lenient and can deal with either a decent hotel with bad customer service or great customer service and a decent hotel, but I can't deal with BOTH. This hotel offers both. For the memorial weekend, I was looking a inexpensive, but decent hotel to stay and when stumbled across the Extended Stay hotel, I thought to myself this can't be soo bad since people stay for long periods of time and the pictures look GREAT! Boy, was I wrong. My boyfriend called me when he first arrived to the hotel to discuss the quality/looks of the hotel and stated that we might want to look at someplace else. I brushed it off thinking he was being too picky. When I arrived, I felt like I came to a drug-infested motel! There were several windows open and people walking around like they had no sense. Going into the lobby, it looked decent but once I walked into the hallway, it was damp, smelly, and filthy. The rooms were spacious, but dirty, smelly, filthy, and poorly organized. My boyfriend told me that he laid in the bed for a minute and was bitten by something. After hearing that, I quickly booked another hotel and called the front desk 3 times to cancel my reservations. The phone rang and rang. I decided to go to the lobby and found the ONLY hotel agent sitting on the couch talking and laughing with a random stranger. I was totally appalled and upset and she explained that she never heard the phone ringing. I made up some lie to the hotel agent about deciding to stay with friends. She was very rude and unsympathetic and told me I would be charged for one night. I checked my account a few days later and found I had been charged 6 different times!! What a nightmare! Please save yourself the stress and find another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Long Stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: plano81
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay for a month while I was getting certified to be a chiropractor. I called the hotel directly and their rates were competitive compared to the other hotels. I didn't want to spend three grand staying at the hilton for a month. Although it was hard to find, it was a huge room for a good rate. The staff was friendly and helped me find everything I needed in the area. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ConsultantStay
Reviews.Content: I am a Technical consultant and travel quite a lot. As such, I have stayed at a number of different hotels, in different cities and states. Initially, I chose this hotel to save money. The manager was able to offer me an excellent rate for an extended stay (few months_ and the rooms seemed fine on the internet. When I arrived there, I was surprised to find that the exterior and lobby were very clean and nice. I had expected much worse for this price. However, my fears were proved right upon entering the room. The furniture was old, the carpet had many large and ugly stains. The carpet itself was not cleaned and on the floor I spotted several ants crawling around. The bathroom was dirty and ugly. Far worse were the walls of the room. They were covered in small stains and dirt of different colors. Horrified, I told them that I was leaving. Its a good thing that I was able to find an available hotel nearby. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. While the price is fine, don't expect anything else. The rooms are cleaned only once a week and probably very badly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Atxguy
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas attending a high school semi final game. Go Pflugville Panthers win state! Anyway, I needed a nice motel fairly close to Texas stadium that was big enough and cheap enough for three guys. The motel was great for our purpose, but it a no-frills type of place. Advantages- large room, kitchen (full refridge, stove, microwave) , wireless internet, interior corridor, several entrances so your car is always near, VCR player in room, . Negatives- no continental breakfast, little to no bathroom amenities, shower was difficult to get the proper water temperature, needs more insulation around pipes/bathroom. There were several youngsters in the hotel as well and many of them were hanging around the halls at night when we came in from our night out. We were ok with this because we were all in our 30s. I can imagine that others would be annoyed by this occurrence. I'm normally not that light of a sleeper, but the noise coming from the pipes -irrespective of whether or not it's from your room- was practically unbearable in the morning hours. INSTALL MORE INSTALLATION IN THIS SUBURBAN MOTEL. I will probably stay there again because of the large room, cheap costs, and location. Maybe they will do something about those pipes by then....

HotelInfo.Name: Suburban Extended Stay Dallas
HotelInfo.Address: 10326 Finnell St, (also known as Suburban Extended Stay), Dallas, TX 75220
